item.title: The economy has an impact on retirement and emergency savings plans in Singapore, according to OCBC
item.description:
Source: OCBC. Average retirement ages by age cohorts. Retirement and emergency planning have taken a backseat in Singapore. OCBC’s research reveals that “planning for retirement” experienced the most significant decline among financial priorities, with the index score dropping from 47 in 2022 to 40 this year. This finding comes from the fifth edition of the annual OCBC Financial Wellness Index, which surveyed 2,000 working adults in Singapore aged 21 to 65 in August 2023...

item.title: How Technology Enables The 4-Hour Workweek
item.description:
Timothy Ferriss’ book, “The 4-Hour Workweek,” captivated my attention with its intriguing title and concept. It challenges the conventional 40-hour workweek and suggests a lifestyle where individuals can achieve personal and financial freedom by working less. Ferriss, who identifies as a “vagabond,” emphasizes embracing technology and shifting perspectives to design a fulfilling life filled with travel and adventure. item.title: The FIRE movement is gaining popularity in Southeast Asia
item.description:
The FIRE (Financial Independence, Retire Early) movement is gaining traction in Southeast Asia. A Milieu Insight study discovered that over 60% of Southeast Asians anticipate retiring between the ages of 50 and 69. Source: Milieu Insight. Different FIRE strategies across Southeast Asia. Retiring before the age of 50 is a possibility for 60% of those surveyed, yet only 14% feel they are on track. Singaporeans are the most doubtful, with only 9% believing they are on track for early retirement...

item.title: Henley & Partners has been selected as the worldwide concessionaire for the Thai residency program
item.description:
Henley & Partners, a global firm specializing in residence and citizenship advisory, has been chosen to promote Thailand’s residence visa program, Thailand Elite. This program allows foreigners to reside in Thailand for up to 20 years. Thailand’s welcoming atmosphere has made it a desirable destination in Southeast Asia. Individuals and families from affluent nations are increasingly drawn to its climate, scenery, and recreational opportunities.
